p: Preventing the spread of infectious diseases like influenza is a high-priority public health challenge. Influenza contributes to approximately 290,000 to 650,000 global deaths annually [ 1]. Seasonal influenza in Singapore presents significant health burdens with 15 influenza-related deaths among every 100,000 people and influenza-associated deaths are 11 times higher among the older adult segment than the general population [ 2]. Furthermore, influenza continues to pose threats of a future global pandemic and thus remains as a public health concern [ 3]. Vaccination remains the most effective practice to prevent influenza infection [ 4].
